name: Composer.Backend.Svg
Composer.Scene
comment:
A `Scene` is set of graphical entities arranged in a spatial representation.
Entities are themselves trees, so a Scene only need to keep the root entity in
order to build complex screens.

A `Scene` also contains the size of the viewport. The viewport is the part
of the scene that is visible. The position is always set to the origin (0, 0).
We can translate the position of the root node to create a camera of a scroll
effect.

The `compose` function translate this scene representation into a flatten set
of primitives that can be consumed by other backend renderers (pdf, svg, canvas,
webgl, etc).

@docs Scene, compose

values.name: compose
values.comment: Reduce a scene to list of primitives.

name: Composer.Scene.Entity

aliases.name: Text
aliases.comment: A piece of text with its font and its font size.
aliases.type: { font : Composer.Text.Font.Font, fontSize : Float, text : String }

values.name: addChild
values.comment: Add a child to an entity.

values.name: children
values.comment: Returns the children of an entity.

values.name: color
values.comment: Returns the color of an entity.

values.name: empty
values.comment:
Creates an empty entity, with no components and no children. You must
guarantee id uniqueness in the whole entity set.

values.name: identifier
values.comment: Returns the identifier of an entity.

values.name: opacity
values.comment: Returns the opacity of an entity.

values.name: setChildren
values.comment: Sets the children of an entity. Previous children are removed.

values.name: setColor
values.comment:
Sets the color of an entity. By itself this components does nothing, but
other components require a color.

values.name: setOpacity
values.comment: Sets the opacity of an entity.

values.name: setShape
values.comment: Sets or removes the shape of an entity.

values.name: setText
values.comment: Sets or removes the text and the font of an entity.

values.name: setTextLayoutOptions
values.comment: Sets the text layout options of an entity.

values.name: setTexture
values.comment: Sets or removes the shape of an entity.

values.name: setTransform
values.comment:
Sets the transform of an entity. You can use functions provided by the
`Transform` module to translate, scale and rotate the entity.

values.name: shape
values.comment: Return the shape of an entity, if any.

values.name: text
values.comment: Sets the text of an entity.

values.name: textLayoutOptions
values.comment: Returns the text layout options of an entity.

values.name: texture
values.comment: Return the texture of an entity, if any.

values.name: transform
values.comment: Return the transform of an entity.

name: Composer.Text

aliases.name: LayoutOptions
aliases.comment:
Options used by text layout algorithm:

  - `horizontalAlign` the horizontal alignment of all paragraphs inside the
    bounding box made by the origin and the size.
  - `lineAlign` the vertical alignment of each line.
  - `lineHeight` the height used by each line.
  - `lineHeightMode` the behaviour to follow when choosing a line height for a
    paragraph.
  - `maxSteps` the number of steps that the shrink algorithm can do at most. See
    shrink function for more info.
  - `scaleFactor` the scale applied on each step when shrinking text. See shrink
    function for more info.
  - `size` the size of the bounding box where the text is layout.
  - `verticalAlign` the vertical alignment of all paragraphs inside the
    bounding box made by the origin and the size.
aliases.type: { horizontalAlign : Composer.Text.HorizontalAlign , lineAlign : Composer.Text.VerticalAlign , lineHeight : Composer.Text.LineHeight , lineHeightMode : Composer.Text.LineHeightMode , maxSteps : Int , scaleFactor : Float , size : Composer.Geometry.Size.Size , verticalAlign : Composer.Text.VerticalAlign }

types.name: HorizontalAlign
types.comment: Specifies the horizontal alignment of a paragraph.

types.name: LineHeight
types.comment:
The value used to set the line height of a text. It can be relative to the
default font line height or an absolute value.

types.name: LineHeightMode
types.comment:
The line height mode is used when computing the line height of a paragraph.
When odd, each line can have different line height from the other lines. When
even, all lines of a paragraph share the same line height.

types.name: VerticalAlign
types.comment:
Specifies the vertical alignment of a paragraph or the vertical alignment of
a line. Note that when used to align the whole paragraph, Baseline is ignored.

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment: Creates a layout options set given a bounding size with sensible defaults.

values.name: layout
values.comment:
Layout a paragraph (a list of units) filling the available space and
following the provided layout options. Usually this involves wrapping the text
into the available width and shrink the units scale until it fits the available
height.
values.type: Composer.Text.LayoutOptions -> List (Composer.Text.Unit.Unit inline) -> List ( Composer.Geometry.Point.Point, Composer.Text.Unit.Unit inline )

values.name: shrink
values.comment:
Wrap text withing a given width and reduce the scale until it fits in the
provided height. Uses the provided scale factor to reduce unit sizes between
steps, for example a 0.05 value means that the content will be reduce by steps
of 5% until the content fits the required size.

In order to guarantee completeness a maxSteps value is required. Higher values
increase the accuracy of the shrinking. For a 0.05 scaleFactor, 16-32 steps are
enough to layout text with common sizes (from 8 to 120 points).

values.name: trim
values.comment: Removes spaces at the beginning and the end of each line.

values.name: wrap
values.comment: Wrap text withing a given width.

name: Composer.Backend.Immediate
comment:
Converts a list of primitives into a list of immediate commands. Immediate
commands are sort of an imperative graphic interface, used by 2D canvas for
example.

@docs render

name: Composer.Text.Unit

aliases.name: Metrics
aliases.comment:
Layout information of a unit or a bunch of units. See metrics function for
more information.

types.name: Unit
types.comment:
A basic unit for the text layout algorithm. Usually this a non divisible
word, but it can also be in-line objects like, for example, images or a line
break.
cases: { content : inline , scale : Float , size : Composer.Geometry.Size.Size , offset : Composer.Geometry.Offset.Offset }
{ font : Composer.Text.Font.Font, fontSize : Float, text : String }

values.name: embed
values.comment:
Embed any content into a unit, creating an Inline unit. The size, scale and
an offset is also needed.
values.type: Float -> Composer.Geometry.Size.Size -> Composer.Geometry.Offset.Offset -> content -> Composer.Text.Unit.Unit content

values.name: font
values.comment: Returns the font of an Unit, if any.

values.name: fontSize
values.comment: Returns the font size of an Unit, if any.

values.name: fromString
values.comment:
Converts a string into a bunch of units. A Font, CodePage and FontSize are
also needed.

values.name: isSingleSpace
values.comment:
Returns True if and only if an unit is a Word Unit which text is a single
space character. See `isWhitespace` for a more useful function.

values.name: isWhitespace
values.comment:
Returns true if the unit is a whitespace. One of the following conditions
must be true if a Unit is a whitespace:

  - A word unit with no characters (There is no way to create these kind of
    units).
  - All characters the text of a Word Unit are white spaces.
  - The fontSize of a Word Unit is less than zero.
  - A Inline Unit with scale equal to zero.
  - A Inline Unit with height or width equal to zero.
  - Is a line break.

values.name: join
values.comment:
Join a list of unit list into a single unit list, interspersing line breaks
between lists.

values.name: joinWords
values.comment:
Given a list of units, join all compatible adjacent words together. By
compatible words we mean word units that have the same properties (codePage,
font and fontSize).

For example, given the following pseudo code,
`[ Word "The", Word " ", Word "Moon", LineBreak, Word "Wow" ]` this function
returns `[ Word "The Moon", LineBreak, Word "Wow" ]`.

Whitespace units that are not single spaces are never joined with other words.
For example, `[Word "The", Word "  ", Word "Moon"]` is not joined as
`[Word "The  Moon"]`.

values.name: lines
values.comment: Remove LineBreak units and return a list unit lines.

values.name: metrics
values.comment:
Returns the metrics of list of units. Metrics are composed by the size of
the bounding box that contains all units, and the offset of the dominant unit.

The dominant unit is the most highest and its offset are useful for aligning
units around the baseline.

values.name: offset
values.comment:
Returns the unit spacing offsets. For word units, all dimensions of the
offset are set to zero but the top, which is equal to the font descent. For
inline units, offset is the same that the unit provides.

values.name: scale
values.comment: Applies a factor to its size.

values.name: size
values.comment: Returns the size of a unit.

values.name: text
values.comment: Returns the text of an Unit, if any.

values.name: toParagraph
values.comment: Returns a textual representation of a list of units. Useful for testing.

values.name: toString
values.comment: Returns a textual representation of a unit. Useful for testing.

name: Composer.Primitive

aliases.name: FontName
aliases.comment: The font name of a text.

aliases.name: FontSize
aliases.comment: The font size of a text.

aliases.name: ImageUri
aliases.comment: A URI pointing to an image.

aliases.name: Opacity
aliases.comment: A float value, 0 means transparent, 1 opaque.

name: Composer.Text.Font
comment:
A module for reading [font](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_font)
descriptions.

Composer only need to known about some font properties in order to layout text.

This module cannot open standard font files, like TrueType (ttf), OpenType
(otf), etc. Instead a JSON definition should be provided. The format of this
definition is the same used by the
[gofpdf](https://godoc.org/github.com/jung-kurt/gofpdf#hdr-Nonstandard_Fonts)
project. Use the `makefont` utility provided by *gofpdf* to create this
definitions.

@docs Description, Font, Type


# Loading Fonts

@docs decoder, empty


# Querying Fonts

@docs glyphWidth, kerning, stringWidth

aliases.name: Description
aliases.comment:
A description containing information common to all font glyphs.

  - `ascent`: the distance above the baseline for singled spaced text.
  - `boundingBox`: a bounding box that can contains any glyph.
  - `capHeight`: the height of a capital letter above the baseline
  - `descent`: the distance below the baseline for singled spaced text.
  - `italicAngle`: the angle of the italic version of the font.
  - `missingWidth`: the width we should assume for a glyph not found in the
    font.
aliases.type: { ascent : Float , boundingBox : Composer.Geometry.BoundingBox.BoundingBox , capHeight : Float , descent : Float , italicAngle : Float , missingWidth : Float }

aliases.name: Font
aliases.comment:
A font record.

  - `codePage`: the codePage of this font.
  - `description`: common information for all glyphs.
  - `kernings`: distance between character pairs.
  - `name`: the font name, in English.
  - `type_`: the underlying font type.
  - `widths`: the width of each glyph, use a [CodePage] to resolve a character
    index.
aliases.type: { codePage : Composer.Text.Font.CodePage.CodePage , description : Composer.Text.Font.Description , kernings : Dict.Dict ( Int, Int ) Float , name : String , type_ : Composer.Text.Font.Type , widths : Array.Array Float }

values.name: decoder
values.comment:
The JSON decoder for a Font. The
[gofpdf](https://godoc.org/github.com/jung-kurt/gofpdf#hdr-Nonstandard_Fonts)
format is used.

values.name: empty
values.comment: An empty Font. Useful for testing.

values.name: glyphWidth
values.comment: Returns the glyph with give an character.

values.name: kerning
values.comment:
Returns the [kerning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerning) given a pair of
chars.

values.name: stringWidth
values.comment:
Returns the with of a given string. This function is similar to glyphWidth
but also takes into account the glyphs kerning.

name: Composer.Text.Font.CodePage

types.name: CodePage
types.comment:
An opaque type (or a private type) that contains the mapping between a
character set and code points (values of an encoding).

values.name: char
values.comment:
Given an index value returns the character associated to that value, if
exists.

values.name: empty
values.comment: An empty CodePage. Useful for testing.

values.name: fromString
values.comment:
Parses a string containing a code page. The format used to represent
CodePages is a textual representation used by
[gofpdf](https://github.com/jung-kurt/gofpdf). Here is a
[CodePage Example](https://github.com/jung-kurt/gofpdf/blob/master/font/cp1250.map)
file.

values.name: index
values.comment: Given a character, return the encoding value of that character, if exists.

name: Composer.Backend.Immediate.Command

values.name: encode
values.comment: Encodes a command into a JSON value.

name: Composer.Geometry.Transform

aliases.name: Transform
aliases.comment:
A 2D transform, only meaningfully cells are kept:

    | m11 m21 m31 |
    | m12 m22 m32 | -> (m11, m12, m21, m22, m31, m32) = Transform
    |  0   0   1  |
aliases.type: ( Float, Float, Float, Float, Float, Float )

values.name: apply
values.comment: Apply a transform to a point.

values.name: combine
values.comment: Combine multiple transform by multiplying them.

values.name: identity
values.comment: The identity transform over the ring of transform matrices.

values.name: multiply
values.comment: Computes the matrix product give two transforms.

values.name: rotation
values.comment: A Transform that represents a ration of the given radians.

values.name: scale
values.comment: A Transform that represents a scaling operation.

values.name: translate
values.comment: A Transform that represents a translation to a point.

name: Composer.Geometry.Rect
comment:
A 2D rectangle defined by a point and a size.

@docs Rect , atOrigin

values.name: atOrigin
values.comment: A rectangle laying on the origin of coordinates (0, 0).

name: Composer.Scene.Shape
comment:
A set a geometrical shapes that entities can draw.

@docs Shape

name: Composer.Geometry.Point
comment:
A type to describe positions in the Cartesian coordinate system.

@docs Point, origin

values.name: origin
values.comment: The origin (0, 0).

name: Composer.Geometry.Offset

aliases.name: Offset
aliases.type: { top : Float, left : Float, bottom : Float, right : Float }

values.name: zero
values.comment: An offset with all the dimensions set to zero.

name: Composer.Geometry.Size
comment:
A type to describe 2d sizes, containing width and height.

@docs Size, zero

values.name: zero
values.comment: A size with all the dimensions set to zero.

name: Composer.Geometry.Radian
comment:
A unit for measuring angles.

@docs Radian

name: Composer.Geometry.BoundingBox

aliases.name: BoundingBox
aliases.type: { xMax : Float, xMin : Float, yMax : Float, yMin : Float }

values.name: zero
values.comment: An BoundingBox with all the dimensions set to zero.
